title: Pressure - calculate pressure at bottom of tank

content.question: A tank with a rectangular base is filled to a depth of <math alttext="3 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> with water of density <math alttext="1000 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1000</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></math>. The tank is open on top. The base of the tank is <math alttext="4 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> long by <math alttext="2 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> wide, as shown in the figure. The absolute pressure of the water at the bottom of the tank is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="1.04 times 10 to the 6 power pascals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.04</mn><mo>Ã—</mo><msup><mtext>10</mtext><mn>6</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Pa</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
